Economic Benefits: With improved communication, businesses would be able to operate more efficiently across borders, leading to increased trade and economic growth.
Education and Cultural Exchange: The ability to communicate more effectively would also facilitate greater cultural exchange and understanding, leading to a more diverse and inclusive world.
Simplification of Travel: With a universal language, the need for translation services would be greatly reduced, making travel more accessible and convenient for people from all over the world.

New Languages and Dialects: A universal language could also lead to the development of new languages and dialects, as people would be able to communicate more effectively with one another and adapt their language to suit their needs.

Cultural Preservation: The dominance of a single language could lead to the preservation of lesser-spoken languages and cultures, as people would be more inclined to learn and preserve their heritage.
